title: How to Redeem & Check an Amazon Gift Card Balance

steps.title: Check your Amazon gift card balance by going to Amazon’s Redeem page.
steps.content: Check your Amazon gift card balance by going to Amazon’s Redeem page . If you’ve already redeemed or loaded your gift card onto your Amazon account, you can check the remaining balance of your card by following this link . From here, you can view your current gift card balance (which is labeled in green) or add another gift card to your account.

steps.title: Sign in to your Amazon account.
steps.content: Sign in to your Amazon account. Go to Amazon.com in a web browser. If you're not signed in already, click the yellow Sign in button in the upper-right corner of the page to sign in now. If you don't have an Amazon account, you'll need to create one to check the balance of and redeem your gift card. To create an account, hover the mouse cursor over the "Sign in" area in the upper-right corner of the page and click Start here . This method will apply the balance of the gift card to your Amazon account, so only use this method if the gift card is for you. If you bought the gift card for someone else, verify the balance by contacting Amazon via chat or phone .

steps.title: Hover your mouse cursor over Account & Lists.
steps.content: Hover your mouse cursor over Account & Lists . This is located in the upper-right corner of the page. A menu will expand when you hold your mouse over the menu icon.

steps.title: Click Gift Card Balance on the menu.
steps.content: Click Gift Card Balance on the menu. Look on the right side of the menu in the "Your Account" section.

steps.title: Click Redeem a Gift Card.
steps.content: Click Redeem a Gift Card . It's the white button near the top of the page. [1] X Research source If you’re unable to locate the link, click here .

steps.title: Locate your claim code.
steps.content: Locate your claim code. The claim code is the 14- or 15-digit code on the back of a physical car (the number revealed when scratching away the protective film) or on your email or paper receipt. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the claim code and click Apply to your balance.
steps.content: Enter the claim code and click Apply to your balance . Look for the yellow button at the top of the page. The balance of the gift card will be added to any gift card balance you already had. [3] X Research source If you already have a balance, click View balance history to see the amount of the last (and all) applied gift cards. Applying the gift card does not mean you have to spend the balance right away—once redeemed, your gift card balance will never expire.

steps.title: Open the Amazon app on your phone, and sign in to your account.
steps.content: Open the Amazon app on your phone, and sign in to your account. Locate the Amazon app on your phone and tap it to open it. If you don't have the Amazon app, you can download it from the App Store (iPhone/iPad) or Play Store (Android). If you haven't signed in, tap the icon of three horizontal lines (the menu icon) and select Sign In . If you don't have an Amazon account, you'll need to create one to check the balance of and redeem your gift card. To create an account, tap Sign In on the menu, select Create account , and follow the on-screen instructions. This method will apply the balance of the gift card to your Amazon account, so only use this method if the gift card is for you. If you bought the gift card for someone else, verify the balance by contacting Amazon via chat or phone .

steps.title: Tap the three-line menu ☰.
steps.content: Tap the three-line menu ☰ . You'll see it at the screen's top-left corner or the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Account.
steps.content: Tap Account . It will be near the bottom of the screen. When you tap Account , a long list of settings will appear.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Manage gift card balance.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Manage gift card balance . This will be under the "Payments" header, which is about halfway down the menu. Your current gift card balance will be displayed at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Redeem another gift card or Redeem.
steps.content: Tap Redeem another gift card or Redeem . You'll see one of these options (or something similar) near the top of the screen, near the balance. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Locate your claim code.
steps.content: Locate your claim code. The claim code is the 14- or 15-digit code on the back of the card (if it's a physical card) or your email or paper receipt. If you have a physical gift card, you may need to peel or scratch the protective coating that covers the claim code to see it. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Enter or scan the claim code.
steps.content: Enter or scan the claim code. You can either type the claim code into the "Enter claim code" field or tap Scan your claim code to use your phone or tablet's camera to scan the code of a physical card. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Apply to your balance.
steps.content: Tap Apply to your balance . Once you click this, the gift card balance will immediately be added to your existing balance, which tells you the card's value. Amazon gift cards don't expire, even once redeemed. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Locate the gift card's claim code.
steps.content: Locate the gift card's claim code. The claim code is the 14- or 15-digit code on the back of the card (if it's a physical card) or your email or paper receipt. If you have a physical gift card, you may need to peel or scratch the protective coating that covers the claim code to find it. Use this method if you want to check the balance of a gift card that you purchased for somebody else. If the gift card was given to you by somebody else and you plan to use it, the easiest way to check its balance is to apply it to your Amazon account . If you're gifting somebody a physical gift card and don't want to remove the code's protective coating, you can also find the claim code printed on the receipt.

steps.title: Sign in to your Amazon account.
steps.content: Sign in to your Amazon account. If you have an Amazon account, you can log in at Amazon.com or by launching the Amazon mobile app and signing in. If you don't have an Amazon account, you'll need to create one so you can chat with a representative.

steps.title: Search for the word help.
steps.content: Search for the word help . To do this, click or tap the search bar at the top of the screen, type “help,” and then press Enter or Return to search.

steps.title: Click or tap Help and customer service.
steps.content: Click or tap Help and customer service . It will be at the top of the screen under the search bar.

steps.title: Initiate a chat with a customer support agent.
steps.content: Initiate a chat with a customer support agent. The steps are a little different depending on whether you're using the mobile app or a computer: Mobile app: Scroll down and tap Need More Help? Tap Contact Us . Something else . Tap I need more help . Computer: If you see the option to do so, click Start chatting now . [8] X Research source If not, click Something else . Click I need more help .

steps.title: Send a message that says find the balance of a gift card without redeeming.
steps.content: Send a message that says find the balance of a gift card without redeeming . When the chat opens, it will open to a bot rather than a representative. If you type this sentence into the chat and press Enter or Return , this will get you through the bot and directly to a customer service agent. [9] X Research source If you'd prefer to have a customer support agent reach you over the phone, click or tap We can call you instead.

steps.title: Provide the claim code to the support agent and request the balance.
steps.content: Provide the claim code to the support agent and request the balance. The support agent will be able to check the balance of the associated card and provide it to you without redeeming the card. [10] X Research source
